intro: Calyptranthes glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting pollinators such as bees and wasps. Calyptranthes glabrescens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
